text:
When using getNamedDispatcher() to get a request dispatcher on a JSP that is defined in web.xml, Tomcat 3.3.x fails to forward to the correct page and returns a 404 instead. web.xml : TestJsp /test/test.jsp code : RequestDispatcher rd = config.getServletContext().getNamedDispatcher("TestJsp"); rd.forward(request, response); result : Not Found (404)

Not Found (404)

Original request: /test/ServletRedirector

Not found request: /test/ServletRedirector Note: This code works on Tomcat 4.x and Tomcat 3.2.4 but not on Tomcat 3.3.x (nightly build of 6th of February 2002). Thanks -Vincent
creator: vmassol@apache.org
william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
This is now fixed in the CVS HEAD, and should show up in 3.3.1-B1.

A temporary work-around is to mark TestJsp as load-on-startup.
